# autoenablesDefaultLighting

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether Scene Kit automatically adds lights to a scene.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var autoenablesDefaultLighting: Bool { get set }
```

```swift
var autoenablesDefaultLighting: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If this property’s value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] (the default), SceneKit automatically adds and places an omnidirectional light source when rendering scenes that contain no lights or only contain ambient lights. If you change the value to false, the only light sources SceneKit uses for rendering a scene are those contained in the scene graph.

## Configuring a 3D Node

- **viewportSize**: The size of the image rendered by the node.
- **scnScene**: The SceneKit scene to render.
- **pointOfView**: The Scene Kit node from which the scene’s contents are viewed when rendered.
